summary:
My interests are in environmental management and impact of Climate change specifically related to  natural and water resources associated with business development, urban and rural planning, waste water reuse for irrigation.  As a creative person, I like interactions with people from different background and expertise. I think that "nobody has a good idea alone", I mean that idea and concept become really good through interactions.

I aim at providing a holistic view of environmental challenges with creative and out-of-the box thinking to enable the understanding of consequences of choice in adaptation to climate change and ultimately to avoid "false good-ideas". 

My professional experiences are on the international market as ESIA expert, senior researcher (Europe, MENA, Africa), as export manager for waste water treatment works and subsidiary Director for a SME.
My Thesis explore which type of stakeholders’ participation is perceived appropriate for which type of water related challenges: societal complexity within the context of the EU Water Framework Directive, governance & conflict resolution.
I am both an engineer and an social scientist (sociology and policy of the environment).
I also worked in war zone and post conflict area as drinking water programme manager for Humanitarian NGOs.
Transversal skills: Project Management, Acquisition Strategy, Partnership Development & networking, 	Subcontractor management, Facilitation & Mediation, Stakeholder Engagement, Gender, coaching & Training, Innovation transfer.

Occupational field: Climate change, Water Energy Food nexus, Circular Economy, Wastewater Reuse, Drinking Water & Wastewater, Valuation of Ecosystem Services, Environmental & Social Impact Assessment - Water Governance - WASH policy.

Work experience: Abu Dhabi, Afghanistan, Algeria, Australia, Belgium, Congo, Denmark, Egypt, France, Germany, Gabon, Ghana, Greece, Guadeloupe, Guinea Conakry, Indonesia, Iraq, Ireland, Italia, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Mali, Malta, Morocco, Norway, RDC, Romania, Rwanda, Serbia, Slovenia, South Africa, South Soudan, Spain, Syria, Chad, Tunisia, Turkey, UK.

And also...Bees keeping, Marathon, Karate, long distance SUP, DIY, organic Gardening, Photography, Natural Horsemanship.

projects:
[{'title': 'Global Innovattion Oasis', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Water is needed for all forms of energy production, 
energy is needed to treat and transport water, 
water and energy are needed to grow food. 
These vital resources are already under great pressure.
Oil & Gas Process Water treatment reuse 
There are 3 main issues to tackle: 
• Produced water can be treated and reuse for irrigation: Smarter water. 
• Oil can be recovered from produced water: Smarter Energy. 
• Soil remediation: polluted soil can be transformed into fertile soil with biological treatment and be used for green belt, fodder crops and horticulture: Smarter Food. 
Green infrastructure 
Green infrastructure is beneficial for the quality of live in the urban environment 
• Vegetation provides cooling through shading and enhanced evapotranspiration. 
• Shading has a direct and significant effect on thermal comfort and microclimate. 
• Green areas improves quality of life: mitigate urban heat island effect, provide recreation area, increase biodiversity, improve air quality. 
• Provide sustainable employment', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Philippe', 'last_name': 'Ker Rault', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director Environment'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Philippe Steiner', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Wolfgang Zimmermann', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Boubaker Medassi', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Arjen Spijkerman', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'John O’Donnell', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Marwan Chaar', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'WAWARIA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'The overarching objective of the pilot project Waste Water Reuse for Irrigation in Algeria (WAWARIA) is to demonstrate the potential to safely valorise waste water treated and polished with membrane based filtration for irrigation purposes. The project consist of installing three irrigation plot for tomatoes, potatoes and cucumber that will be irrigated with 3 water quality: i) traditional water for irrigation (ground water), ii) current treated waste water, iii) tertiary polished water with membrane. In order to implement the project a ELTSO-NRO Fusion membrane filtration device will polished the waste water produced by the Waste Water Treatment Works of the city of Ouargla then stored and used for irrigation through dripping irrigation device defined by Alterra. Ground water and treated waste water will irrigate identical irrigation device to compare crop growth, heavy metals and organic compounds in water, soil and plants.
The project is co-managed by Alterra and ONA, our Partners are Eltso NRO-Fusion, PB Techniek, INRAA.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Philippe', 'last_name': 'Ker Rault', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director Environment'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gerard', 'last_name': 'Sijl', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Technical Consultant bij Drost Technisch Beheer'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'ton de Kort', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'amar chouikh', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Ourahmoun Halim', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Said Zitouni', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'abdesslem Chettouh', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'joop', 'last_name': 'harmsen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Retired at Wageningen University & Research'}]}]
